title: Characterization of mercury in atmospheric particulate matter in the state of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
content:
Environ. Sci.: Atmos., 2024, 4,872-878
DOI: 10.1039/D4EA00044G, Paper
Open Access

Luis Fhernando Mendonça da Silva, Caio Silva Assis Felix, Madson Moreira Nascimento, Jailson Bittencourt de Andrade, Maria Cristina Canela, Cibele Maria Stivanin de Almeida, Carla Semiramis Silveira, Renato da Silva Carreira, Adriana Gioda
The study investigates mercury levels in PM2.5 in regions of Rio de Janeiro: urban areas, areas affected by sugar cane burning, and an environmental reserve. It highlights seasonal variations and pollution contributions, both local and transboundary.
